explanations.A: Picture a number line. You're at −3 but want to get to 2. This can be thought of in two stages: from −3 to 0 (so 3 steps) and from 0 to 2 (another 2 steps). Altogether 5 steps will take you to 2, so −3 ＋ 5 = 2.
explanations.B: I think you have counted the numbers rather than the jumps. If you start at -3, how many jumps up is it to 2?
explanations.C: I think you have done -3 + 2. If we start at -3, how many jumps up do we do to get to 2?
explanations.D: Almost, just remember that we are starting at a negative and moving up the number line to a positive.
